intro: Eustrephus timorensis, commonly known as the Timor lily, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in shades of red and pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy texture, while its stems are slender and herbaceous. Eustrephus timorensis is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
